summary: Quick readiness check with all roles present; no decisions made. Action items: client to set agenda/priorities, PM to pick meeting type, and developer to wait for assignment; QA clarified testing handoff format.

actions.task: Provide meeting agenda and priorities for today's session
Select and announce meeting type to run (vision, requirements, planning, review, retrospective)
Stand by to receive implementation task assignment once agenda/priorities are defined

risks.risk: No clear agenda or priorities defined, which may stall the meeting and work assignments
risks.mitigation: Client to provide agenda/priorities immediately; PM to confirm meeting type and prioritize items

risks.risk: Potential architecture/design blockers if requirements are unclear
risks.mitigation: Mike (Architect) to be available to unblock architecture questions and provide rapid decisions when needed

risks.risk: Unclear testing handoff format could delay QA verification
risks.mitigation: Team to use the established convention: post "Ready for testing!" with an explicit Expected output string so QA can run tests promptly
